sentences.english: There is a rare silver Buddha and many musical instruments in Dazhao Temple.
sentences.chinese: 大昭寺有珍奇的銀佛和許多樂器。

sentences.english: With April's first-born flowers, and all things rare.
sentences.chinese: 四月新花和所有的珍奇。

sentences.english: Mt. Tai abounds in lofty peaks, deep valleys, and rare cultural relics of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 泰山峯高谷深，莊嚴穩重，有豐富的珍奇的古代文物。

sentences.english: Here are the greatest number of our plants, and here are the curious pheasants.
sentences.chinese: 我們的大多數花木都在這裏，這裏有珍奇的野雞。

sentences.english: The islands are surrounded by barrier reefs that are home to hundreds of unusual and exotic creatures.
sentences.chinese: 環繞羣島的大堡礁，蘊育了好幾百種珍奇的海洋生物。

sentences.english: Some spirits and rare wines are imported from Europe.
sentences.chinese: 一些烈酒和珍奇的紅酒是從歐洲進口的。

sentences.english: Many people come to Changbaishan to study its unique plants and animals.
sentences.chinese: 許多人到長白山來研究珍奇的動植物。

sentences.english: I also began to analyze my husband the way a trainer considers an exotic animal.
sentences.chinese: 我也學馴獸師分析珍奇動物一樣開始分析我丈夫。

sentences.english: You can see many rare animals in the Beijing Zoo.
sentences.chinese: 在北京動物園你可以看到許多珍奇動物。

sentences.english: It was very generous of you to send me such a beautiful and fancy gift.
sentences.chinese: 你給我寄來如此美麗而又珍奇的禮物，真是太慷慨了。

definition: a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
treasure-house/treasury/treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)
